channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Economic Pessimism Peaks, So Why Are Investors Still Buying?
item.description: The unemployment rate begins to rise as job growth slows in the latest jobs report, prompting many to wonder, “Will this finally lead to interest rate cuts?” With so many […]

item.title: EU opens child safety probes of Facebook and Instagram, citing addictive design concerns
item.description: Facebook and Instagram are under formal investigation in the European Union over child protection concerns, the Commission announced Thursday. The proceedings follow a raft of requests for information to parent entity Meta since the bloc’s online governance regime, the Digital Services Act (DSA), started applying on it last August. The development could be significant as […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Susan Chira to Step Down as The Marshall Project’s Editor-in-Chief in January
item.description: Under her stewardship, the news nonprofit more than doubled in size, opened local newsrooms and won its second Pulitzer Prize.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: Meme Stocks Surged Again This Week—But I’m Not Buying the Hype
item.description: Are they headed to the moon, or is this just a temporary blip?

item.title: Forget EVs: Why Bedrock Materials is targeting gas-powered cars for its first sodium-ion batteries
item.description: Bedrock Materials is developing a new type of sodium-ion battery, which promises to be dramatically cheaper than lithium-ion. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: When Bad Cops Become Private Security Guards
item.description: There’s growing evidence that former officers with troubling histories of abuse can easily find second careers in private security.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.

item.title: Inflation Eases Slightly in April But Still Holds Above 3%
item.description: The latest CPI report shows inflation up 0.3% in April, which shelter and gasoline leading the increase.

item.title: Thoma Bravo’s LogRhythm merges with Exabeam in more cybersecurity consolidation
item.description: Private equity giant Thoma Bravo has announced that its security information and event management (SIEM) company LogRhythm will be merging with Exabeam, a rival cybersecurity company backed by the likes of Cisco and Lightspeed Venture Partners. SIEM is the business of using real-time data gleaned from servers, network devices, and applications to flag abnormal activity […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Rare Bright Spot for a Canine Lover Doing Time: Raising Puppies to Become Service Dogs
item.description: Adam Roberts reflects on the highs and occasional lows of training Labrador retrievers for the Puppies Behind Bars program.

item.title: How to Build a Support Network for Schizophrenia Care
item.description: Schizophrenia caregiver support is essential to avoid burnout. Learn how to build a support network when you're a mental-health caregiver.

item.title: 5 Ways Property Management Software Can Make You a Better Landlord
item.description: Property management software helps you run your business more efficiently.

item.title: Temu accused of breaching EU’s DSA in bundle of consumer complaints
item.description: Consumer protection groups around the European Union have filed coordinated complaints against Temu, accusing the Chinese-owned ultra low-cost e-commerce platform of a raft of breaches related to the bloc’s Digital Services Act (DSA). Temu only launched in the region about a year ago but recently reported blasting past 75 million monthly users. Penalties for confirmed […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins the Dart Award for “The Mercy Workers”
item.description: Our feature on mitigation specialists who help save people from the death penalty was recognized for making “significant contributions to public understanding of trauma-related issues.”

item.title: Helping Someone Stick With Schizophrenia Treatment
item.description: Schizophrenia treatment is tricky when your loved one resists it. Learn ways to help someone with schizophrenia stick with their treatment plan.

item.title: If You’re Only Focused on Buying Properties, You’re Doing It Wrong
item.description: Paying close attention to tenant segments can make or break your success as an investor and landlord.

item.title: Google I/O 2024: Here’s everything Google just announced
item.description: Here are quick hits of the biggest news from the keynote as they are announced. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Weinstein Ruling Poses Quandary: Can #MeToo Coexist With Protections for Defendants?
item.description: Proving sex crimes often requires evidence that is generally excluded to protect the rights of the accused.

item.title: Is It Time to Change Schizophrenia Treatments?
item.description: Is it time for a change in your loved one's schizophrenia treatment? Learn the signs caregivers should watch for.
